quiz.title: Unit 3: Motion & Graphs (Quiz 1, Part 3)
quiz.subtitle: Advanced Motion Concepts and Problem Solving (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: Which of the following is true about acceleration?
options: It is always in the direction of motion
It cannot be zero for a moving object
questions.explanation: Acceleration can be negative (deceleration) when an object slows down.

questions.question: A stone is dropped from a cliff. After 2 seconds, its velocity is 19.6 m/s downward. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Acceleration due to gravity is approximately 9.8 m/s² downward.

questions.question: What does a curved line on a position-time graph indicate?
questions.explanation: A curved position-time graph indicates changing velocity (acceleration).

questions.question: A jogger runs 2 km in 15 minutes, then rests for 5 minutes, then runs 1 km in 8 minutes. What is their average speed for the entire period?
questions.explanation: Total distance = 3 km, total time = 28 minutes = 0.467 hours. Average speed = 3 km / 0.467 h ≈ 6.43 km/h.

questions.question: Which of the following motions has constant acceleration?
options: A car turning a corner at constant speed
A ball rolling down a straight ramp
questions.explanation: A ball rolling down a straight ramp has constant acceleration due to gravity.

questions.question: A train increases its speed from 30 m/s to 50 m/s over 100 seconds. What is its acceleration?
questions.explanation: Acceleration = (50 - 30) m/s / 100 s = 20 m/s / 100 s = 0.2 m/s².

questions.question: What is the velocity of an object that moves 20 meters east in 4 seconds?
questions.explanation: Velocity = displacement / time = 20 m east / 4 s = 5 m/s east.

questions.question: Which statement about distance and displacement is correct?
options: Displacement can never be greater than distance
Displacement is always greater than distance
questions.explanation: Displacement is the straight-line distance between start and end points, so it can never exceed the total distance traveled.

questions.question: A car travels 120 km in 1.5 hours. What is its average speed?
questions.explanation: Average speed = 120 km / 1.5 h = 80 km/h.

questions.question: What does a positive slope on a velocity-time graph indicate?
options: The object is moving at constant velocity
questions.explanation: Positive slope on velocity-time graph means velocity is increasing - the object is accelerating.

questions.question: An object moves with a constant acceleration of 3 m/s². If its initial velocity is 5 m/s, what will its velocity be after 4 seconds?
questions.explanation: Final velocity = initial velocity + (acceleration × time) = 5 m/s + (3 m/s² × 4 s) = 17 m/s.

questions.question: On a position-time graph, what does a line with a steeper slope indicate compared to a line with a shallower slope?
options: The object is moving in the opposite direction
questions.explanation: The slope represents velocity. A steeper slope means a greater rate of change of position, indicating higher speed.

questions.question: A car travels halfway around a circular track with a radius of 100 m. What is the distance traveled and the magnitude of displacement?
questions.explanation: Distance = half the circumference = π × 100 m ≈ 314 m. Displacement = diameter = 2 × 100 m = 200 m.

questions.question: If the velocity-time graph of an object is a straight line with a negative slope, the object is:
options: Speeding up in the positive direction
Slowing down in the positive direction
questions.explanation: A negative slope on a velocity-time graph indicates decreasing velocity (deceleration) in the positive direction.

questions.question: A particle moves from point A to B to C along a straight line. If AB = 5 m and BC = 12 m, what is the minimum possible distance and maximum possible displacement?
questions.explanation: The minimum distance is the straight path A to C (if B is between them): 5 + 12 = 17 m. The maximum displacement is also 17 m if all motion is in the same direction.

questions.question: An object's position-time graph is a parabola opening upward. What can be said about its acceleration?
questions.explanation: A parabolic position-time graph indicates constant acceleration. Opening upward means positive acceleration.

questions.question: A car accelerates uniformly from 10 m/s to 30 m/s covering a distance of 200 m. What is its acceleration?
What is represented by the area under a velocity-time graph?
questions.explanation: The area under a velocity-time graph represents the displacement of the object.

questions.question: A ball is thrown vertically upward. At the highest point of its trajectory, what is its velocity and acceleration?
questions.explanation: At the highest point, vertical velocity is zero, but acceleration due to gravity is still 9.8 m/s² downward.

questions.question: If an object has a position-time graph that is a straight line with a slope of -4 m/s, which statement is true?
options: The object is moving at 4 m/s in the positive direction
The object is moving at 4 m/s in the negative direction
The object is accelerating at -4 m/s²
questions.explanation: A negative slope on a position-time graph indicates motion in the negative direction at 4 m/s.
